greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: DR(n,d) is the number of properly d-dimensional polyominoes with n cells, modulo translations and rotations (n >= 1, 0 <= d <= n-1).
comment: Table 1 (p. 366) in Lunnon (1975) contains more terms. Because the table there (in the reference) has incomplete columns, the extra terms do not appear in this triangular sequence (array).

Entry DR(n=11, d=2) in Table 1 (p. 366) must be a typo. It should not be 33890, but 33895. This was corrected by _N. J. A. Sloane_ in 2011 in the documentation of sequence A006758. (See also sequence A000988.)

The number of oriented polyominoes (chiral pairs counted as two) here is the sum of the number of unoriented polyominoes (chiral pairs counted as one) in A049430 and the number of chiral pairs. - _Robert A. Russell_, May 03 2020
link: W. F. Lunnon, Counting multidimensional polyominoes, Computer Journal 18 (4) (1975) 366-367.
formula: We can add unoriented and chiral pairs for the top two diagonals. The summands have quick algorithms. (End)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 22 2011
ext: Sequence corrected by _Petros Hadjicostas_, Jan 11 2019 after observation by _Jon E. Schoenfield_
